thread.title: SPREAD THIS: Conservative Leaders Developing Nationwide Demonstrations to Support Trump
thread.title_full: SPREAD THIS: Conservative Leaders Developing Nationwide Demonstrations to Support Trump

author: Ben Marquis
title: SPREAD THIS: Conservative Leaders Developing Nationwide Demonstrations to Support Trump

organizations.name: conservative leaders developing nationwide demonstrations to support trump trump

text:
Trump Says Being President Is “Surreal” But That “There’s So Much Work To Be Done” 
This pro-Trump movement has developed plans to hold what are being dubbed “Spirit of America” rallies, scheduled in several states nationwide for Feb. 27 and March 4. 
A key organizer in the effort is Debbie Dooley, a national co-founder of the tea party movement, who declared in a news release that, “These rallies are inclusive, non-partisan, and open to anyone supporting President Trump in his efforts to bring back manufacturing jobs to America, put the security of our nation ahead of political correctness, improve our infrastructure, revitalize the inner cities and secure our nation’s borders.” 
Dooley hopes to mobilize the “silent majority” that voted Trump into office as a response to the anti-Trump protests, and that “silent majority” includes plenty of pro-Trump women and even some Democrats supportive of the president, often referred to as “ Trumpocrats .” Advertisement - story continues below 
It is worth noting that the Feb. 27 date of the first “Spirit of America” nationwide rally is also the anniversary of the first major tea party event in 2009. 
Other leaders quoted in the news release included retired Air Force Col. Rob Maness and Ralph King, an Electoral College member from Ohio. 
“I am proud to lead the charge here in Louisiana to get supporters of President Trump to show their support of his policy agenda through these Spirit of America rallies,” stated Maness, a two-time Senate candidate and founder of the pro-Trump GatorPAC , which is dedicated to assisting in the effort to “drain the swamp.” 
“Average citizens from across the political spectrum and all walks of life elected Mr. Trump and we at GatorPAC are especially pleased to help him with his national effort to Make America Great Again and #DrainTheSwamp priorities in Washington, D.C.” Advertisement - story continues below
